channel.title: Best Monsters to Train On
channel.description:
I'm a quantitative kind of guy. I like to work with numbers to achieve solid evidence. So I decided to look at F2P monsters to see which are the best for power-leveling. The most relevant stats when looking at F2P monsters are health and defense. A monster with higher HP is good; you have to click less often, which less time in-between monsters. A monster with low defense is good; you deal more damage in a given time-frame than on a higher defense monster.
However, there is a tiny little hitch. We don't know a monster's defense. We only know their level. Already we're trekking into some uncertain area. We can only assume that their defense directly correlates with their level; as their level goes up, their defense goes up proportionately. Therefore, HP has an even larger weight. For any given level, if HP is higher, then assuming the other cb stats are equal, their defense must, consequently, be a bit lower. When we take the ratio HP/CB of a monster, the higher ratios are more favorable to train on, and the lower ratios are less favorable to train on. This is a general trend.
Despite this, there are yet more issues. Armor/skin significantly affects the defense, depending on which end of the pk triangle we are talking about. As stated earlier, we cannot know whether defense is ridiculously high and attack is low, or vice versa, without experimental data. Also, the respawn time and time between fights is another problem that can't easily be considered quantitatively, among others.
I still decided to make a chart of HP vs. Level. Monsters on or above the line are optimal targets, notably ice giants, level 42 hobgoblins, and al-kharid warriors. Though White Knights are well above the line, I wouldn't consider them prime range or even melee targets.
[img]http://sneamia.net/sr/images/hpvslvl_lin.gif[/img]
I am aware that it gets extremely crowded in the bottom [b]left[/b] (thanks, Beanie). I'll set the scale to logarithmic tomorrow night and upload it with the correct labels.

item.title: Best Monsters to Train On
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Some monsters that stood out for

Melee: Level 42 Hobgoblin, Al Kharid Guard, Ice Giant, Level 59 Skeleton, Chaos Dwarf
Mage: Al Kharid Guard, White Knight, Level 59 Skeleton, Chaos Dwarf
Range: Level 42 Hobgoblin, Ice Giant, Level 59 Skeleton, Chaos Dwarf

Read full topic
